extendedInfo.description: Share content like text, links or images via email, httppost, ftp, sftp, Dropbox or Box without further user interaction. No need to enter the target email adress every time you want to share something.Share offline: Delayed WIFI only sharing is possible.Like Google+ share your photos instantly after taking them (optional).How to use: Start app for settings and set up for example an email account.Open Gallery -> press MENU -> Share -> AutoShareOpen Webbrowser -> touch website address and hold until Share menu appears -> Share -> AutoshareSame in many other apps which offer sharing ...After activating New picture in the system settings you can also have your photos shared/uploaded instantly after taking them without further interaction (like google plus).If your @google.com email is not working - try @googlemail.com!Why is this helpful?Everyone is social now. Most of the time I am not. I often use the built-in Android share function to send stuff to myself. Or to my website.Everyone is using DropBox now. Most of the time I am not. I still use my own FTP for data exchange and storage.Everyone is sharing photos now. Most of the time I send simple text or links for later inspection to myself. All content is possible with AutoShare.This simple app enables you after a one time initial setup to share content with a single click on AutoShare.Advanced users: The http post method enables you to do EVERYTHING you can dream of with your shared content if you write your own php script receiving and processing the content (simple example php is included in the app settings). This method also keeps data traffic lower than processing everything on your Android or sending to multiple receivers. Upload pictures to your own gallery. Add links to your homepage. Send text to your blog. Share media. Try it.

reviews.title: It works!
reviews.comment: Finally one click upload to my server over SFTP. Who need clouds when you have your own server?  I got my settings wiped on phone reboot and SFTP settings are mixed with FTP in a non-intuitive way, but in the end it works and that\'s what matters.
reviews.author: Jakub Ru\305\276i\304\215ka

reviews.title: very nice app!
reviews.comment: do what it is designed to do. But why i can\'t Autoshare selected group of pictures? only one by one.
reviews.author: Eugene Prozector

reviews.title: Automatic sharing doesn\'t work?
reviews.comment: Automatic sharing doesn\'t seem to work with Sony Xperia Z using sony\'s own camera app. Shame. :-(
reviews.author: Juha Suhonen

reviews.title: Works
reviews.comment: First solution that actually works with sftp.  Has once deleted my settings...
reviews.author: Ilja Sara

reviews.title: almost 5 stars
reviews.comment: It clears your settings when it updates and doesn\'t tell you they\'ve been cleared when you try to use autoshare as usual.
reviews.author: Tim Redmond

reviews.title: Fantastic Utility app I use constantly
reviews.comment: Warning, update deletes current settings, would have given 5 stars otherwise. Love the new Profiles, Delayed Sending (I often have no connection when needed) and the BOX & Custom Intents. Great job developer.  If there a paid version without ads?
reviews.author: J Mattey

reviews.title: great idea
reviews.comment: love this app.  really useful and saves times.  i just wish there was an option to add a prefix to the title so you could automatically filter it into an inbox folder.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfect for web-savvy
reviews.comment: This allows me to upload photos to my own web server, exactly what I wanted.  The author even includes sample PHP code to run server-side (only a dozen or so lines).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great for Adding Videos to MyPlex to Watch Later
reviews.comment: Excellent app with even more capabilities than I am currently using. I needed a great all applications share app to send selected videos from my mobile to my MyPlex email address to watch later on my htpc. This app used with Plex has basically given me the Android/Windows equivalent of AirPlay! I cant thank you enough!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment: I dont like to rely on 3rd party web services, I have my own servers, and this lets me upload my content to those very well. Lightweight, stable, I like it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works like a charm!
reviews.comment: Great app that works as advertised! I use it to upload pictures taken to my FTP.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.comment: I have it set up to automatically upload photos taken with my phone to my sftp server.  Works perfectly.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Just what I needed!
reviews.comment: Set this up with a little PHP script that redirects to the file with the latest creation time in a directory, so I upload a file and can just send someone the link to http://mydomain.tld/stuff and it sends them to the file. I have it stop redirecting if the file is > 5 minutes old so that my latest uploaded file isn\'t discoverable in perpetuity.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Otherwise great
reviews.comment: Some error handling/reporting needed if upload fails.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: Works great on S3 with gmail, and honestly, why wouldn\'t you use gmail?!

reviews.comment: I use it to forward content to my Gmail. So quick.
